name: Category Spending Analysis
description: Analyze spending by category with flexible aggregation
sql_hint:
Example: For category spending analysis, you can use flexible GROUP BY with category normalization:
SELECT
  COALESCE(ut.provider_tx_category_detailed, ut.category_detailed, ut.provider_tx_category, ut.category, 'Uncategorized') AS category,
  SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_spend,
  COUNT(*) AS transaction_count
FROM public.unified_transactions ut
WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND ut.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '{days} days'
  AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
  AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
  AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
GROUP BY category
ORDER BY total_spend DESC
examples: how much did I spend by category

name: Cash Flow (Last 6 Months)
description: Monthly income, spending, and net cash flow for the last 6 months.
sql_hint:
WITH months AS (
  SELECT date_trunc('month', d)::date AS month
  FROM generate_series(
    date_trunc('month', CURRENT_DATE) - INTERVAL '5 months',
    date_trunc('month', CURRENT_DATE),
    INTERVAL '1 month'
  ) d
),
agg AS (
  SELECT
    date_trunc('month', ut.transaction_date)::date AS month,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount > 0 THEN ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS income,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= (date_trunc('month', CURRENT_DATE) - INTERVAL '5 months')
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT m.month, COALESCE(a.income,0) AS monthly_income, COALESCE(a.spend,0) AS monthly_spend,
       COALESCE(a.income,0) - COALESCE(a.spend,0) AS net_cash_flow
FROM months m
LEFT JOIN agg a ON a.month = m.month
ORDER BY m.month
examples: income and spending trend last six months

name: Upcoming Liability Payments (Next 45 Days)
description: List active liabilities with a due date in the next 45 days and their minimum payments.
sql_hint:
SELECT
  l.name,
  l.category,
  l.minimum_payment_amount,
  l.next_payment_due_date
FROM public.unified_liabilities l
WHERE l.user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND COALESCE(l.is_active,true)=true
  AND l.next_payment_due_date IS NOT NULL
  AND l.next_payment_due_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '45 days')
ORDER BY l.next_payment_due_date ASC

name: Top Recurring Expenses (Last 6 Months)
description: Rank recurring merchants by total spend over the last 6 months.
sql_hint:
WITH base AS (
  SELECT
    COALESCE(NULLIF(ut.merchant_name,''), NULLIF(ut.name,'')) AS merchant,
    -ut.amount AS spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= (date_trunc('month', current_date) - INTERVAL '5 months')
    AND ut.amount < 0
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_recurring,false)=true
)
SELECT merchant, SUM(spend) AS total_recurring_spend, COUNT(*) AS tx_count
FROM base
WHERE merchant IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY merchant
ORDER BY total_recurring_spend DESC
LIMIT 10

name: Emergency Fund (Mean and Median, Last 6 Months)
description: Compute both mean and median monthly spend to recommend 3–6 month emergency fund.
sql_hint:
WITH m AS (
  SELECT date_trunc('month', ut.transaction_date) AS month,
         SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS monthly_spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= (date_trunc('month', current_date) - INTERVAL '5 months')
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT
  COALESCE(AVG(monthly_spend),0) AS avg_monthly_spend_6m,
  percentile_cont(0.5) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY monthly_spend) AS median_monthly_spend_6m,
  COALESCE(AVG(monthly_spend),0) * 3 AS recommended_low_mean,
  COALESCE(AVG(monthly_spend),0) * 6 AS recommended_high_mean,
  percentile_cont(0.5) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY monthly_spend) * 3 AS recommended_low_median,
  percentile_cont(0.5) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY monthly_spend) * 6 AS recommended_high_median
FROM m

name: Financial Health Metrics
description: Net worth, income/spend, savings rate, DTI
sql_hint: WITH i30 AS(SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ut.amount),0) AS inc FROM public.unified_transactions ut WHERE ut.user_id='{user_id}' AND ut.transaction_date>=CURRENT_DATE-INTERVAL '30 days' AND ut.amount>0 AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false),s30 AS(SELECT COALESCE(SUM(-ut.amount),0) AS spd FROM public.unified_transactions ut WHERE ut.user_id='{user_id}' AND ut.transaction_date>=CURRENT_DATE-INTERVAL '30 days' AND ut.amount<0 AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false),mp AS(SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ul.minimum_payment_amount),0) AS debt_pmt FROM public.unified_liabilities ul WHERE ul.user_id='{user_id}' AND COALESCE(ul.is_active,true)=true),a AS(SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ua.estimated_value),0) AS assets FROM public.unified_assets ua WHERE ua.user_id='{user_id}' AND COALESCE(ua.is_active,true)=true),l AS(SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ul.principal_balance),0) AS liabs FROM public.unified_liabilities ul WHERE ul.user_id='{user_id}' AND COALESCE(ul.is_active,true)=true) SELECT a.assets,l.liabs,a.assets-l.liabs AS net_worth,i30.inc,s30.spd,CASE WHEN i30.inc>0 THEN 1-(s30.spd/i30.inc) ELSE NULL END AS savings_rate,mp.debt_pmt,CASE WHEN i30.inc>0 THEN mp.debt_pmt/i30.inc ELSE NULL END AS dti FROM a,l,i30,s30,mp

name: Spending and Income Trends (Year-to-Date)
description: Monthly spending and income trends for the current year (fills missing months; one query, no pre-checks).
sql_hint:
WITH months AS (
  SELECT date_trunc('month', d)::date AS month
  FROM generate_series(
    date_trunc('year', current_date)::date,
    date_trunc('year', current_date)::date + interval '11 months',
    interval '1 month'
  ) d
),
agg AS (
  SELECT
    date_trunc('month', ut.transaction_date)::date AS month,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS monthly_spend,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount > 0 THEN ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS monthly_income
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= date_trunc('year', current_date)
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT m.month, COALESCE(a.monthly_spend,0) AS monthly_spend, COALESCE(a.monthly_income,0) AS monthly_income
FROM months m LEFT JOIN agg a ON a.month = m.month
ORDER BY m.month ASC

name: Discretionary vs Essential Spend (30D)
description: Split last 30 days spend into essential vs discretionary using category heuristics.
sql_hint:
WITH base AS (
  SELECT
    CASE
      WHEN provider_tx_category IN ('RENT_AND_UTILITIES','MORTGAGE','HOME_IMPROVEMENT','HOME_INSURANCE','GROCERIES','TRANSPORTATION','INSURANCE','HEALTHCARE') THEN 'essential'
      ELSE 'discretionary'
    END AS bucket,
    CASE WHEN amount < 0 THEN -amount ELSE 0 END AS spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions
  WHERE user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days'
    AND COALESCE(pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(is_payment,false)=false
)
SELECT bucket, SUM(spend) AS total_spend
FROM base
GROUP BY bucket
ORDER BY total_spend DESC

name: Income Volatility (6M)
description: Compute monthly income over last 6 months, with mean and coefficient of variation.
sql_hint:
WITH months AS (
  SELECT date_trunc('month', d)::date AS month
  FROM generate_series(
    date_trunc('month', current_date) - interval '5 months',
    date_trunc('month', current_date),
    interval '1 month'
  ) d
),
agg AS (
  SELECT date_trunc('month', ut.transaction_date)::date AS month,
         SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount > 0 THEN ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS monthly_income
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= (date_trunc('month', current_date) - interval '5 months')
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
  GROUP BY 1
),
series AS (
  SELECT m.month, COALESCE(a.monthly_income,0)::numeric AS monthly_income
  FROM months m LEFT JOIN agg a ON a.month = m.month
)
SELECT
  AVG(monthly_income) AS avg_income_6m,
  CASE WHEN STDDEV_POP(monthly_income) IS NOT NULL AND AVG(monthly_income) > 0
       THEN STDDEV_POP(monthly_income) / AVG(monthly_income)
       ELSE NULL END AS income_cv_6m
FROM series

name: Largest Month of Spending (YTD)
description: Identify the highest-spend month in the current year.
sql_hint:
WITH monthly AS (
  SELECT date_trunc('month', ut.transaction_date)::date AS month,
         SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS monthly_spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= date_trunc('year', current_date)
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false

)
SELECT month, monthly_spend
FROM monthly
ORDER BY monthly_spend DESC

name: Weekday vs Weekend Spend (90D)
description: Compare spending on weekdays vs weekends (last 90 days).
sql_hint:
WITH base AS (
  SELECT
    CASE WHEN EXTRACT(ISODOW FROM transaction_date) IN (6,7) THEN 'weekend' ELSE 'weekday' END AS day_type,
    CASE WHEN amount < 0 THEN -amount ELSE 0 END AS spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions
  WHERE user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '90 days'
    AND COALESCE(pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(is_payment,false)=false
)
SELECT day_type, SUM(spend) AS total_spend
FROM base
GROUP BY day_type
ORDER BY total_spend DESC

name: Housing Spend Share (Last 90 Days)
description: Compute housing spend share vs total spend using provider and display categories.
sql_hint:
WITH totals AS (
  SELECT COALESCE(SUM(-ut.amount), 0) AS total_spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '90 days'
    AND ut.amount < 0
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
),
housing AS (
  SELECT COALESCE(SUM(-ut.amount), 0) AS housing_spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '90 days'
    AND ut.amount < 0
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
    AND (
      ut.provider_tx_category IN ('RENT_AND_UTILITIES','MORTGAGE','HOME_IMPROVEMENT','HOME_INSURANCE')
      OR ut.category ILIKE 'HOUSING%'
      OR ut.category ILIKE 'RENT%'
      OR ut.category ILIKE 'MORTGAGE%'
      OR ut.category ILIKE 'UTILIT%'
      OR ut.category_detailed ILIKE 'HOUSING%'
      OR ut.category_detailed ILIKE 'RENT%'
      OR ut.category_detailed ILIKE 'MORTGAGE%'
      OR ut.category_detailed ILIKE 'UTILIT%'
    )
)
SELECT h.housing_spend, t.total_spend,
       CASE WHEN t.total_spend > 0 THEN h.housing_spend / t.total_spend ELSE NULL END AS housing_spend_share
FROM housing h, totals t

name: Debt-to-Income Ratio (Minimum Payments)
description: Monthly minimum debt payments divided by recent monthly income.
sql_hint:
WITH income_30d AS (
  SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ut.amount), 0) AS income_30d
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days'
    AND ut.amount > 0
),
min_pay AS (
  SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ul.minimum_payment_amount), 0) AS monthly_debt_payments
  FROM public.unified_liabilities ul
  WHERE ul.user_id = '{user_id}' AND COALESCE(ul.is_active, true) = true
)
SELECT m.monthly_debt_payments, i.income_30d,
       CASE WHEN i.income_30d > 0 THEN m.monthly_debt_payments / i.income_30d ELSE NULL END AS dti
FROM min_pay m, income_30d i

name: Emergency Savings Recommendation (3-6 months)
description: Compute average monthly spend and derive recommended 3–6 months emergency fund.
sql_hint:
WITH monthly AS (
  SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', ut.transaction_date) AS month,
         SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS monthly_spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= (DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE) - INTERVAL '5 months')
  GROUP BY 1
),
avg_spend AS (
  SELECT COALESCE(AVG(monthly_spend), 0) AS avg_monthly_spend_6m FROM monthly
)
SELECT a.avg_monthly_spend_6m,
       a.avg_monthly_spend_6m * 3 AS recommended_low,
       a.avg_monthly_spend_6m * 6 AS recommended_high
FROM avg_spend a
examples: how much should i have in emergency savings

name: Time Series Spending Analysis
description: Track spending trends over time periods
sql_hint:
Example: For time-based analysis, normalize dates and use flexible date ranges:
SELECT
  DATE_TRUNC('day', COALESCE(t.transaction_date, t.authorized_date)) AS spend_date,
  SUM(CASE WHEN t.amount > 0 THEN t.amount ELSE 0 END) AS daily_spend,
  COUNT(*) AS transaction_count
FROM {transactions} t
WHERE t.user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND DATE_TRUNC('day', COALESCE(t.transaction_date, t.authorized_date)) >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '{days} days'
GROUP BY spend_date
ORDER BY spend_date ASC

name: Merchant Spending Analysis
description: Analyze spending patterns by merchant
sql_hint:
Example: For merchant analysis, normalize merchant names and use flexible ranking:
WITH merchant_summary AS (
  SELECT
    COALESCE(NULLIF(t.merchant_name, ''), NULLIF(t.name, '')) AS merchant,
    SUM(CASE WHEN t.amount > 0 THEN t.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_spend,
    COUNT(*) AS transaction_count,
    AVG(CASE WHEN t.amount > 0 THEN t.amount ELSE NULL END) AS avg_transaction
  FROM {transactions} t
  WHERE t.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND t.tx_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '{days} days'
  GROUP BY merchant
)
SELECT * FROM merchant_summary
WHERE merchant IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY total_spend DESC
LIMIT {top_k}

name: Flexible Date Range Analysis
description: Handle various date range patterns flexibly
sql_hint:
Example: For flexible date handling, use normalized dates with multiple strategies:
-- Last N days
WHERE COALESCE(t.transaction_date, t.authorized_date) >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '{days} days'

-- Specific date range
WHERE COALESCE(t.transaction_date, t.authorized_date) BETWEEN '{start_date}' AND '{end_date}'

-- Month-based
WHERE DATE_TRUNC('month', COALESCE(t.transaction_date, t.authorized_date)) = DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE)

-- Year-to-date
WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM COALESCE(t.transaction_date, t.authorized_date)) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE)

name: Emergency Fund Coverage
description: Liquid assets vs essential expenses 3-12mo
sql_hint: WITH la AS(SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ua.estimated_value),0) AS liq FROM public.unified_assets ua WHERE ua.user_id='{user_id}' AND COALESCE(ua.is_active,true)=true AND ua.category IN('cash','checking','savings','money_market','cd')),ee AS(SELECT COALESCE(SUM(-ut.amount),0) AS ess FROM public.unified_transactions ut WHERE ut.user_id='{user_id}' AND ut.transaction_date>=CURRENT_DATE-INTERVAL '90 days' AND ut.amount<0 AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false AND(ut.provider_tx_category IN('RENT_AND_UTILITIES','MORTGAGE','HOME_IMPROVEMENT','HOME_INSURANCE','GROCERIES','TRANSPORTATION','INSURANCE','HEALTHCARE','BANK_FEES') OR ut.category ILIKE 'HOUSING%' OR ut.category ILIKE 'FOOD%' OR ut.category ILIKE 'TRANSPORTATION%' OR ut.category ILIKE 'MEDICAL%' OR ut.category ILIKE 'BANK%')),ma AS(SELECT(ess/3) AS avg_ess FROM ee) SELECT la.liq,ma.avg_ess,CASE WHEN ma.avg_ess>0 THEN la.liq/ma.avg_ess ELSE NULL END AS months,CASE WHEN ma.avg_ess>0 AND la.liq/ma.avg_ess>=6 THEN 'EXCELLENT' WHEN ma.avg_ess>0 AND la.liq/ma.avg_ess>=3 THEN 'ADEQUATE' ELSE 'INSUFFICIENT' END AS rating,ma.avg_ess*3 AS min_rec,ma.avg_ess*6 AS opt_rec FROM la,ma

name: Debt Payoff Projections
description: Project debt payoff timelines based on current cash flow and payment strategies
sql_hint: WITH debt_details AS (SELECT ul.name,ul.principal_balance,COALESCE(ul.interest_rate,0) AS interest_rate,COALESCE(ul.minimum_payment_amount,0) AS min_payment,CASE WHEN ul.is_overdue=true THEN 'HIGH' ELSE 'NORMAL' END AS priority FROM public.unified_liabilities ul WHERE ul.user_id='{user_id}' AND COALESCE(ul.is_active,true)=true),available_cash AS (SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ut.amount),0)-COALESCE(SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount<0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END),0) AS monthly_surplus FROM public.unified_transactions ut WHERE ut.user_id='{user_id}' AND ut.transaction_date>=CURRENT_DATE-INTERVAL '30 days' AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false),total_debt AS (SELECT SUM(principal_balance) AS total_balance FROM debt_details) SELECT dd.name,dd.principal_balance,dd.interest_rate,dd.min_payment,CASE WHEN ac.monthly_surplus>dd.min_payment THEN ROUND(dd.principal_balance/(ac.monthly_surplus-dd.min_payment),1) ELSE NULL END AS months_to_payoff,CASE WHEN dd.interest_rate>0.08 THEN 'AVOID_EXTRA_PAYMENTS' WHEN dd.interest_rate<0.04 THEN 'PAY_AGGRESSIVELY' ELSE 'BALANCED_APPROACH' END AS payoff_strategy FROM debt_details dd,available_cash ac,total_debt td ORDER BY CASE dd.priority WHEN 'HIGH' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END,dd.interest_rate DESC,dd.principal_balance DESC
examples: how long to pay off my debt

name: Active Accounts List
description: List all active accounts with key balances and status.
sql_hint:
SELECT
  id,
  name,
  institution_name,
  account_type,
  account_subtype,
  account_number_last4,
  currency_code,
  current_balance,
  available_balance,
  credit_limit,
  principal_balance,
  is_active,
  is_overdue,
  is_closed,
  created_at
FROM public.unified_accounts
WHERE user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND COALESCE(is_active, true) = true
ORDER BY account_type, name;

name: Account Balances by Type
description: Aggregate balances by account_type including principal/original where applicable.
sql_hint:
SELECT
  account_type,
  SUM(COALESCE(current_balance, 0))            AS total_current_balance,
  SUM(COALESCE(principal_balance, 0))          AS total_principal_balance,
  SUM(COALESCE(original_principal, 0))         AS total_original_principal,
  SUM(COALESCE(total_value, 0))                AS total_investment_value
FROM public.unified_accounts
WHERE user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND COALESCE(is_active, true) = true
GROUP BY account_type
ORDER BY total_current_balance DESC;

name: Upcoming Minimum Payments (45D)
description: Credit/loan/mortgage accounts with a minimum payment due in the next 45 days.
sql_hint:
SELECT
  id AS account_id,
  name AS account_name,
  institution_name,
  account_type,
  minimum_payment_amount,
  next_payment_due_date,
  current_balance
FROM public.unified_accounts
WHERE user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND COALESCE(is_active, true) = true
  AND account_type IN ('credit','loan','mortgage')
  AND minimum_payment_amount IS NOT NULL
  AND minimum_payment_amount > 0
  AND next_payment_due_date IS NOT NULL
  AND next_payment_due_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '45 days')
ORDER BY next_payment_due_date ASC;

name: Credit Utilization by Card
description: Compute utilization for credit accounts with safe fallbacks.
sql_hint:
SELECT
  id AS account_id,
  name AS account_name,
  institution_name,
  credit_limit,
  available_credit,
  CASE
    WHEN credit_limit IS NOT NULL AND available_credit IS NOT NULL AND credit_limit > 0
      THEN ROUND(GREATEST(credit_limit - available_credit, 0) / credit_limit * 100, 2)
    WHEN credit_limit IS NOT NULL AND current_balance IS NOT NULL AND credit_limit > 0
      THEN ROUND(GREATEST(current_balance, 0) / credit_limit * 100, 2)
    ELSE NULL
  END AS utilization_pct
FROM public.unified_accounts
WHERE user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND COALESCE(is_active, true) = true
  AND account_type = 'credit'
  AND (credit_limit IS NOT NULL OR available_credit IS NOT NULL OR current_balance IS NOT NULL)
ORDER BY utilization_pct DESC NULLS LAST;

name: Overdue Liabilities
description: Show overdue liability accounts with days overdue.
sql_hint:
SELECT
  id AS account_id,
  name AS account_name,
  account_type,
  principal_balance,
  current_balance,
  minimum_payment_amount,
  next_payment_due_date,
  (CURRENT_DATE - DATE(next_payment_due_date))::int AS days_overdue
FROM public.unified_accounts
WHERE user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND COALESCE(is_active, true) = true
  AND COALESCE(is_overdue, false) = true
ORDER BY next_payment_due_date ASC NULLS LAST;

name: 30D Cash Flow by Account
description: Income, spend, net over last 30 days per account.
sql_hint:
WITH tx AS (
  SELECT
    ut.account_id,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS spend_30d,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount > 0 THEN ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS income_30d
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days'
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
  GROUP BY ut.account_id
)
SELECT
  ua.id AS account_id,
  ua.name AS account_name,
  ua.institution_name,
  ua.account_type,
  ua.current_balance,
  COALESCE(tx.spend_30d, 0)  AS spend_30d,
  COALESCE(tx.income_30d, 0) AS income_30d,
  COALESCE(tx.income_30d, 0) - COALESCE(tx.spend_30d, 0) AS net_30d
FROM public.unified_accounts ua
LEFT JOIN tx ON tx.account_id = ua.id
WHERE ua.user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND COALESCE(ua.is_active, true) = true
ORDER BY spend_30d DESC, income_30d DESC;
examples: income and spend by account last 30 days

name: 30D Cash Flow by Account Type
description: Income, spend, net over last 30 days grouped by account_type.
sql_hint:
WITH agg AS (
  SELECT
    ua.account_type,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS spend_30d,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount > 0 THEN ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS income_30d
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  JOIN public.unified_accounts ua ON ua.id = ut.account_id
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ua.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days'
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
  GROUP BY ua.account_type
)
SELECT
  account_type,
  COALESCE(income_30d,0) AS income_30d,
  COALESCE(spend_30d,0)  AS spend_30d,
  COALESCE(income_30d,0) - COALESCE(spend_30d,0) AS net_cash_flow_30d
FROM agg
ORDER BY net_cash_flow_30d DESC;
examples: cash flow by account type last 30 days

name: Debt Payments by Account (90D)
description: Identify payment transactions for debt accounts in the last 90 days.
sql_hint:
SELECT
  ua.id AS account_id,
  ua.name AS account_name,
  ua.institution_name,
  SUM(ABS(ut.amount)) AS total_payments_90d,
  COUNT(*) AS payment_txn_count
FROM public.unified_transactions ut
JOIN public.unified_accounts ua ON ua.id = ut.account_id
WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND ua.user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND ut.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '90 days'
  AND ua.account_type IN ('credit','loan','mortgage')
  AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
  AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
  AND (
       COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=true
    OR ut.provider_tx_category IN ('LOAN_PAYMENTS','CREDIT_CARD_PAYMENTS')
    OR COALESCE(ut.category,'') ILIKE 'PAYMENT%'
    OR COALESCE(ut.category_detailed,'') ILIKE 'PAYMENT%'
    OR COALESCE(ut.merchant_name, ut.name, '') ILIKE '%PAYMENT%'
  )
GROUP BY ua.id, ua.name, ua.institution_name
ORDER BY total_payments_90d DESC;
examples: how much did I pay to debts last 90 days

name: Top Merchants by Account (90D)
description: Largest merchant spend by account in the last 90 days.
sql_hint:
WITH base AS (
  SELECT
    ut.account_id,
    COALESCE(NULLIF(ut.merchant_name,''), NULLIF(ut.name,'')) AS merchant,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ut.amount < 0 THEN -ut.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_spend
  FROM public.unified_transactions ut
  WHERE ut.user_id = '{user_id}'
    AND ut.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '90 days'
    AND COALESCE(ut.pending,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_cancelled,false)=false
    AND COALESCE(ut.is_payment,false)=false
  GROUP BY ut.account_id, COALESCE(NULLIF(ut.merchant_name,''), NULLIF(ut.name,''))
)
SELECT
  ua.name AS account_name,
  ua.institution_name,
  b.merchant,
  b.total_spend
FROM base b
JOIN public.unified_accounts ua ON ua.id = b.account_id
WHERE ua.user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND b.merchant IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY b.total_spend DESC
LIMIT 25;

name: Investment Balance Safety Check
description: Use COALESCE(total_value, current_balance) for investment types to avoid undercounting.
sql_hint:
SELECT
  account_type,
  SUM(COALESCE(
        CASE WHEN account_type IN ('401k','ira','brokerage','investment_other')
             THEN COALESCE(total_value, current_balance)
             ELSE current_balance
        END, 0)) AS total_value_safe
FROM public.unified_accounts
WHERE user_id = '{user_id}'
  AND COALESCE(is_active, true) = true
GROUP BY account_type
ORDER BY total_value_safe DESC;

name: Assets & Liabilities (Accounts)
description: List assets vs liabilities from unified_accounts (classify by account_type).
sql_hint: SELECT CASE WHEN ua.account_type IN ('credit','loan','mortgage') THEN 'liability' ELSE 'asset' END AS record_type,ua.name,ua.account_type AS category,ua.current_balance AS amount,'plaid' AS source FROM public.unified_accounts ua WHERE ua.user_id='{user_id}' AND COALESCE(ua.is_active,true)=true AND ua.current_balance IS NOT NULL UNION ALL SELECT 'asset',a.name,a.category,a.estimated_value,'manual' FROM public.unified_assets a WHERE a.user_id='{user_id}' AND COALESCE(a.is_active,true)=true AND a.estimated_value IS NOT NULL UNION ALL SELECT 'liability',l.name,l.category,l.principal_balance,'manual' FROM public.unified_liabilities l WHERE l.user_id='{user_id}' AND COALESCE(l.is_active,true)=true AND l.principal_balance IS NOT NULL ORDER BY 1,5,2;
